refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: msql_query sends a query to the currently active database on the server that's associated with the specified link identifier. If the link identifier isn't specified, the last opened link is assumed. If no link is open, the function tries to establish a link as if msql_connect was called, and use it.
Returns a positive mSQL query identifier on success, or &false; on error.

example.title: msql_query example
example.programlisting:
<?php 
$link = msql_connect("dbserver")
   or die("unable to connect to msql server: " . msql_error());
msql_select_db("db", $link)
   or die("unable to select database 'db': " . msql_error());

$result = msql_query("SELECT * FROM table WHERE id=1", $link);
if (!$result) {
   die("query failed: " . msql_error());
}

while ($row = msql_fetch_array($result)) {
    echo $row["id"];
}
?>

refsect1.para: See also msql_db_query, msql_select_db, and msql_connect.
